channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Dad of girl murdered by Stephen Leonard says review rebuff 'unfair'
item.description: Jim Holt's daughter Lorraine was murdered in 1979 by a man who would try to kill again in 2018.

item.title: Afghan refugee: Taliban takeover 'like a scary movie'
item.description: Refugee Marwa Koofi fled Afghanistan after being abducted at Kabul airport as the government fell.

item.title: Matfen Hall: Hotel U-turn after weddings cancelled amid price hike
item.description: In a statement, Matfen Hall says it was "never our intention to cause any upset".

item.title: The 22-year-old who took on a housing giant and won
item.description: As a new report claims dilapidated housing can kill, the BBC meets an unlikely champion for tenants.

item.title: Former IS teenage bride Shamima Begum offers to help fight terror in UK
item.description: The 22-year-old, who left London at 15 to join the Islamic State group, says she could be useful.

item.title: BT to recruit 1,000 people at new Birmingham site
item.description: The company says it is committed to having more opportunities away from London.

item.title: Kew Gardens: Royal Botanic Gardens breaks record for largest plant collection
item.description: Established in 1759, the Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew has 16,900 unique plant species.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry told police failed in response to bombing
item.description: Police "failed" in their response to the Manchester Arena attack in 2017, an inquiry hears.

item.title: Duchess of Cambridge meets team involved in Afghan evacuation
item.description: Catherine speaks to those involved in the operation, which saw thousands airlifted out of Kabul.

item.title: Durham fire: Crews sent to Milburngate development
item.description: The blaze started in a wall of the shopping, leisure, office and housing complex in Durham.

item.title: Middlesbrough brain surgery patient left with clip under skin
item.description: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust says the patient was not harmed by the error.

item.title: British Pie Awards: Vegan bakes on the rise as contest returns
item.description: The 72 vegan entries make it the largest of the 23 categories.

item.title: Would you use a hotel for house plants?
item.description: A "hotel" catering exclusively for house plants has opened in London, as sales soared during the pandemic.

item.title: Brendon Prince: Round-Britain paddleboarder completes challenge
item.description: Sea safety campaigner Brendon Price was escorted to shore by a flotilla of paddleboards.

item.title: Drunk driver with child in car smashes into lorry in Chesterfield
item.description: Declan Webster was racing with friends before the huge crash in Chesterfield.

item.title: The Birmingham LGBT café providing a safe space
item.description: The not-for-profit café has a "pay-as-you-feel" policy so people struggling financially can eat.

item.title: The litter-laden alleyways transformed by residents
item.description: Residents decided to turn fly-tipping-laden alleyways into vibrant community spaces.

item.title: Liverpool 3-2 AC Milan: Reds pull off comeback in Champions League epic
item.description: Jordan Henderson's strike gives Liverpool victory in a remarkable Champions League group opener against AC Milan.

item.title: Manchester City 6-3 RB Leipzig: Last season's runners-up off to flying start
item.description: Jack Grealish scores a wonderful goal on his Champions League debut as Manchester City put the pain of losing last season's final behind them to beat RB Leipzig.

item.title: Sarina Wiegman: Demi Stokes says Lionesses are 'excited' by the new England boss' style of play
item.description: Manchester City defender Demi Stokes says the Lionesses are "excited" to adopt new England boss Sarina Wiegman's style of play.

item.title: Middlesbrough defeat piles pressure on Forest boss Hughton
item.description: Middlesbrough hand Nottingham Forest a sixth defeat in seven games to increase pressure on boss Chris Hughton.

item.title: Emma Raducanu 'hungry' to improve after US Open win - but not sure on Indian Wells
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu says she is "hungry" to improve after her US Open win but wants a few days' rest first.
